div.p: Greetings. Now, as I return from the mountains late at night, reverend father, your letters are lying on the table and are delivered for the first time on the 5th of October. Therefore, I am very grateful to you; for you have done more than I dared to hope. I have nothing, and if I had anything, I would not fail in my duty.
Mr. Haller wrote ambiguously about the English and German army and their progress; we desire more certain information at some point. Farewell, reverend father in Christ.
To the most distinguished man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, most worthy Antistes of the Church of Zurich, his lord and father in Christ. Zurich to Mr. Bullinger.
